intro: Tococa temnoptera, commonly known as the Andean coffee plant, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other coffee species, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds used for coffee production, though it is less commercially cultivated than other coffee species. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts within its native habitat.
